en-US.summary: Control your AudioBookshelf library with voice commands
examplePhrases: Alexa, ask audio bookshelf to continue my book
Alexa, tell audio bookshelf to play Ready Player One
en-US.name: AudioBookshelf
en-US.description:
AudioBookshelf is a custom Alexa skill that allows you to control your self-hosted AudioBookshelf server using voice commands. Listen to your audiobooks and podcasts hands-free.

Features:
- Play audiobooks by title
- Continue where you left off
- Automatic progress tracking
- Search your library

Requirements:
- An AudioBookshelf server (v2.0 or later)
- Your server must be accessible via HTTPS
- An AudioBookshelf account with API access

Setup:
1. Install and configure your AudioBookshelf server
2. Enable the skill and link your AudioBookshelf account
3. Start listening with voice commands!

Example commands:
- 'Alexa, ask audio bookshelf to continue my book'
- 'Alexa, tell audio bookshelf to play The Hobbit'
- 'Alexa, ask audio bookshelf to pause'

Note: This is a custom skill for self-hosted AudioBookshelf servers. You must have your own AudioBookshelf instance to use this skill.

publishingInformation.testingInstructions:
1. Link your AudioBookshelf account in the Alexa app
2. Ensure your AudioBookshelf server is accessible via HTTPS
3. Say 'Alexa, open audio bookshelf'
4. Try commands like 'continue my book' or 'play [book title]'
